issues.description: The UML diagram in the problem statement specifies Stock.add(String) as returning void (+add(String): void), but both the template and the solution implement Stock.add(String) to return an int. Because the problem text instructs students to implement classes according to the diagram, this mismatch between the diagram and the provided code can confuse students about the correct method signature and return type. Students following the UML might change the template signature to void (causing compilation errors with the provided template and solution usage), or be uncertain which version is authoritative.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the return type consistent across artifacts. Either update the UML in the problem statement to show +add(String): int (recommended, to match the template and solution), or change the template and solution implementations so that add(String) returns void and adjust any code that depends on the returned value. The simpler fix preserving the provided code is to correct the diagram and any descriptive text to indicate add returns int.
